result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryell D Zigler

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryell D Zigler appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas James for Justin L. Singleton appeared by video for Bryell D Zigler.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  
Discussion held. Defendant has a felony matter (22CF1451) in Branch 19 and will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer.
Court authorizes transfer to Branch 19 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted.   
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 095340,
Payable Number: 1037192,
Receipt Number: 22RP040191,
Amount: $20.00
Order to Cancel Warrant, signed & filed.

Defendant Bryell D Zigler in court.  Attorney Thomas James in court for Bryell D Zigler.  Prosecuting attorney Alicia H Kort in court for the State of Wisconsin. Br 45 for Br 15:  Parties before the court to explain reason for missed appearance.  The Court quashed the warrant and amended the bail to $1,000. Signature Bond, all previous non monetary conditions remain.  Case is adjourned for scheduling conference in Br 15.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bryell D Zigler not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case calendared for a calendar call. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Court ordered bench warrant issued, Remand to the Judge, and forfeiture of bond.
Calendar call on August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryell D Zigler not in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for status of counsel. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Cae remains calendared in Br. 15.  Calendar call scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryell D Zigler in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  Defendant appears without counsel.  Court set a status of counsel date.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse. Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06-24-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Bryell D Zigler in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton as a friend of the court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Bryell D Zigler
Current: 611 North 20th Street, #305, Milwaukee, WI 53233   (Effective: 06-22-2022)
Prior: 601 North 20th Street, #112, Milwaukee, WI 53233
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Bryell D Zigler not in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/31/2022@1p
